title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
content: Some people do complain that Trezor do not have secure element, but this wallet, Trezor Safe 3 comes with secure element certified chip EAL6+, 0.96" Monochromatic OLED 128 x 64 pixels screen. USB-C. It comes in four colours which are cosmic black, galactic rose, stellar silver and solar gold. You can order for either universal (bitcoin and altcoins) or bitcoin-only wallet.https://blog.trezor.io/introducing-trezor-safe-3-bitcoin-only-celebrating-10-years-of-trust-31d0f4fea07ehttps://trezor.io/trezor-safe-3Although, it comes with Trezor coinjoin which is not recommended.Preorder price: $79What do you think about this wallet? Is it worth buying?

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Hello, we have had a similar conversation here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5469307.0I wanted it to have a camera for airgapped transactions personally. This is my major complaint. The price is ok in my opinion. Finally the BTC only version shouldn't be limited edition but a proper product.

I used the keyword Trezor safe 3 to search on this forum to know if the topic has been existing but I did not see anything. I am just knowing this right now. I will lock this thread and continue on the other thread.It is worth mentioning that o_e_l_e_o commented on the other thread that the secure element is close source, just like others like Ledger Nano. The wallet is cheap but I will not go for anything that I do not know how it is generating my seed phrase, keys and addresses. Trezor has continued going worse.
